alert.note: Alert for Chatanika River Valley; Delta Junction; Eielson AFB and Salcha; Fairbanks Metro Area; Fortymile Country; Goldstream Valley and Nenana Hills; Nenana; South Slopes Of The Eastern Brooks Range; Tanana Flats; Two Rivers; Upper Chena River Valley; Upper Tanana Valley; Yukon Flats (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 28 at 5:39AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Cold Through Friday With Snow Expected Over The Weekend... A cold Arctic airmass now covers all of Northern Alaska with valley temperatures in the 20s and 30s below, while hills and windy areas are between 10 below and 10 above. These cold temperatures will continue into Friday. Temperatures will rise closer to normal Friday night and Saturday as clouds and snow move over the Eastern Interior. Several inches of snow are possible over the weekend. Snow will taper off Sunday with clouds thinning by Monday. This could bring return of clear skies cold temperatures early next week.
